entries.name: Age
entries: Dwarves reach adulthood in their early teens and rarely live more than 60 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most dwarves are lawful, believing firmly in the benefits of a well-ordered society.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dwarves are 3 to 4 feet tall, and are always considered Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Echolocation
entries: You can use your action to sing, whistle, scream or otherwise use sound in order to gain blindsight up to a 30 foot radius until the end of your turn. You must be able to hear the sound in order to benefit from this ability.

entries.name: Limited Arcane Immunity
entries: You automatically succeed any saving throws made to resist the effects of a spell with a level equal to or lower than half of your proficiency bonus. You can choose not to benefit from this trait.

entries.name: Arcane Ineptitude
entries: You are unable to activate magical items and can only benefit from those that give off passive continuous benefits. In addition, you can only attune to up to 2 items instead of 3, and you must reduce by 1 this limit if it ever increases.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Dwarvish and Common.

entries.name: Elemental Resistance
entries: You have resistance to one of the following damage types: acid, fire, lightning, poison, or cold.

entries.name: Brave
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Far Thrower
entries: You don't have disadvantage on attack rolls made with a ranged or thrown weapon when your target is beyond normal range.

entries.name: Poison Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Nimbleness
entries: You have advantage on rolls made to resist being grappled or restrained, as well as rolls made to escape a grapple.

entries.name: Focused
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

entries.name: Bred for War
entries: You're proficient with all types of armor, and you ignore the heavy property of any weapon you use

entries.name: Dwarven Stability
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being shoved or knocked prone.

entries.name: Spell Resilience
entries: When you roll a 1 on a saving throw against a spell, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

entries.name: Age
entries: Elves reach adulthood in their early teens and rarely live more than 60 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most elves are chaotic, with no clear sense of identity or loyalty beyond whatever gives them happiness at the time.

entries.name: Size
entries: Elves are 4 to 5 feet tall, but much skinnier than humans. They are considered Medium.

entries.name: Elven Adaptability
entries: You can change your appearance over an extended period of time. You can grow hair, sprout leaves or flowers, cat claws, wolf noses, any kind of gender signifiers and other extraneous body parts over time. You can choose a single body part to grow at a time, and must do it over an entire month which you spend living with a creature or plant that shares that property. These body parts don't change your fundamental capabilities: eagle eyes don't change your sight, a wolf nose won't improve your sense of smell, and cat claws are too weak to scratch anything with sufficient force.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Elven and one other language of your choice, which can include the ability to communicate with a specific animal species.

entries.name: Humanoid Kinship
entries: You can give up 1 Ability Score increase to obtain one of the following traits through your Elven Adaptability instead:

entries.caption: Humanoid Kinship
rows: Superior Darkvision, Echolocation, Brave (Dragon), Nimbleness (Snake), Stability (Stone)
Determination, Skill Versatility (Generalist), Prolific Mind (Sharp), Relentless Endurance (Tough)

entries.name: Animal Kinship
entries: You can give up 1 Ability Score increase to obtain two of the following traits through your Elven Adaptability instead: Keen Smell, Keen Sight, Keen Hearing, Amphibious, Relentless, Standing Leap, Running Leap, Spider Climb, Underwater Camouflage, Ink Cloud, Sure-Footed, Beast of Burden, Mimicry (raven), or a natural weapon (1d6 damage for a single weapon and 1d4 for a multi-weapon, such as claws or tentacles).

entries.name: Floral Longevity
entries: Flora Elves reach maturity in their early 20s, and have a lifespan of up to 100 years.

entries.name: Plant Kinship
entries: You can give up 1 Ability Score increase to obtain one of the following traits through your Elven Adaptability instead:

entries.caption: Plant Kinship
rows: You can forgo your Move Action to give yourself advantage to resist being pushed or knocked prone.
You gain a number of temporary hit points at the end of a long rest equal to your proficiency + your Constitution modifier.
You can use your reaction to gain resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder damage until the end of that turn.
You automatically succeed any death roll you make, and you regain 1 hit point as soon as you suceed 3 of them.

entries.name: Age
entries: Goroth reach adulthood by the time they reach 10 years of age and can live up to 120 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Goroth tend to be neutral: loyal to their family and role, but chaotic in their attitude towards the world.

entries.name: Size
entries: Goroth are 7 to 8 feet tall, and they're considered Medium.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Stalwart Resilience
entries: You have Damage Reduction against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage equal to your proficiency bonus. Damage Reduction bonuses don't stack, and only the highest one applies.

entries.name: Stone's Endurance
entries: You can focus yourself to occasionally shrug off injury. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a {@dice d12}. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled, and reduce the damage by that total. After you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common.

entries.name: Goroth Craft
entries: You gain expertise in one set of {@filter artisan's tools|items|source=phew|type=artisan's tools} or a {@filter musical instrument|items|source=phew|type=instrument} of your choice.

entries.name: Goroth Artist's Role
entries: You can add your Charisma modifier to a Dexterity check or saving throw you make, or add your Dexterity modifier to a Charisma check or saving throw you make, a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You must decide if you wish to use this feature before making the {@dice d20} roll. You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Passed Down Knowledge
entries: You can speak, read, and write Goroth, and you add half your proficiency bonus (min. 1) to your Intelligence modifier in order to determine how long your {@variantrule Downtime Activity; Training|PHEW|training} takes. Goroth is a language that was used by this race in the past, before they started relations with the rest of the humanoids. All Goroth know some words in this language, and they use them regularly in their speech.

entries.name: Goroth Erudite's Role
entries: You can add your Intelligence modifier to a Wisdom check or saving throw you make, or add your Wisdom modifier to an Intelligence check or saving throw you make, a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You must decide if you wish to use this feature before making the {@dice d20} roll. You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Giant Kin
entries: When you're wearing no armor, your AC equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier. In addition, your Stalwart Resilience also grants you Damage Reduction against fire and cold damage.

entries.name: Goroth Warrior's Role
entries: You can add your Strength modifier to a Constitution check or saving throw you make, or add your Constitution modifier to a Strength check or saving throw you make, a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You must decide if you wish to use this feature before making the {@dice d20} roll. You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Age
entries: Homs reach adulthood in their mid teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Homs tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

entries.name: Size
entries: Homs vary wildly in height and build, from barely 5 feet tall to over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in this range your size is Medium.

entries.name: Determination
entries: You can choose to give yourself advantage before making an attack roll, saving throw or ability check. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, write and read Common and one extra language of your choice. Homs typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills and one tool of your choice.

entries.name: Well Traveled
entries: You can read, speak, and write an additional two languages of your choice.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Increase either your Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma score by 2, and two other Ability Scores of your choice increase by 1 each.

entries.name: Prolific Mind
entries: When you gain your 1st character level and gain proficiency in skills from the list in your class's description, you gain expertise in one of the chosen skills, which means you add double your proficiency bonus to skill checks with that skill.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Increase either your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution score by 2, and two other Ability Scores of your choice by 1.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Age
entries: Titans do not grow or age, but they do deteriorate over time. Titans have potentially eternal lives.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Titans are as varied as the souls that were used to build them. They tend to no particular alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Titans vary somewhat in size, between 6 and 7 feet tall. Regardless of your position in this range your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Mechanical Form
entries: Whenever you would regain hit points, except at the end of a long rest and for effects that work when you spend your hit dice, you regain only half the amount (rounded up). On the other hand, you can spend 1 hit dice when you're the target of the {@spell mending|PHEW} cantrip.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries: You are immune to any spell or effect that would alter your form.

entries.name: Artificial Body
entries: You are immune to sleep. You don't need to eat, sleep or breathe. You only need 30 minutes in order to finish a short rest and 4 hours of inactivity in order to finish a long rest. During a long rest, you are aware of your surroundings but can't think or move without interrupting your rest and requiring another full 4h to rest.

entries.name: Artificial Soul
entries: You have disadvantage on resurrection rolls, and you're considered to be dead for a day for each hour that passes up to 24, and a year for every day that passes since your death.

entries.name: Half-Construct
entries: You are immune to disease and the poisoned condition, and resistant to poison damage.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, write and read Dwarvish and one extra language of your choice. Titans typically learn the language of their master.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 20 feet, but being encumbered, heavily encumbered, or moving a grappled creature don't reduce your speed.

entries.name: Giant Armor Plating
entries: You cannot wear armor, but you're considered to be wearing heavy armor. Your Armor Class equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier.

entries.name: Giant Frame
entries: Any allied creatures within 5 feet of you have three quarters cover against ranged attacks.

entries.name: Combat Armor Plating
entries: You cannot wear armor, but you're considered to be wearing light armor. Your Armor Class equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries: You deal double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Slam
entries: You can make a special unarmed strike called a slam. It's a melee weapon attack you're proficient with that has a weapon die of 1d8 and deals bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Reliable Scouting
entries: You can choose 10 instead of rolling whenever you make a Dexterity or Wisdom skill check for a skill you're proficient with a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You can only replace one of the dice if you have disadvantage on the roll.
